quotes.quote: I guessed life was like that. You gained and you lost, and if you saved anything from the ruins, even if only a shred of self-respect, it was enough to take you through the next bit.
In the midst of winter, I finally learned there was in me an invincible summer.
We all have the strength to endure the misfortunes of others.
Without the strength to endure the crisis, one will not see the opportunity within. It is within the process of endurance that opportunity reveals itself.
So comes snow after fire, and even dragons have their endings.
To learn strong faith is to endure great trials. I have learned my faith by standing firm amid severe testings.
It is more difficult to stay on top than to get there.
Endurance pierces marble.
Life asks not merely what you can do; it asks how much can you endure and not be spoiled.
It is the nature of the strong heart, that like the palm tree it strives ever upwards when it is most burdened.
If you're going to go through hell... I suggest you come back learning something.
To struggle when hope is banished! To live when life's salt is gone! To dwell in a dream that's vanished. To endure, and go calmly on!
Endurance is the crowning quality, And patience all the passion of great hearts.
Children's talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.
Happy he who learns to bear what he cannot change.
Endurance is not a young person's game. I thought I might even be better at 60 than I was at 30. You have a body that's almost as strong, but you have a much better mind.
Solitude, isolation, are painful things and beyond human endurance.
Come what may, all bad fortune is to be conquered by endurance.
At the end of the day it's about how much you can bear, how much you can endure. Being together, we harm nobody; being apart, we extinguish ourselves.
People have to learn sometimes not only how much the heart, but how much the head, can bear.
I learned from the example of my father that the manner in which one endures what must be endured is more important than the thing that must be endured.
To be or not to be isn't the question. The question is how to prolong being.
Yes, as my swift days near their goal, 'Tis all that I implore: in life and death a chainless soul with courage to endure.
All philosophy lies in two words, sustain and abstain.
Those who can bear all can dare all.
Life is not a PG feel-good movie. Real life often ends badly. Literature tries to document this reality, while showing us it is still possible for us to endure nobly.
No matter how much falls on us, we keep plowing ahead. That's the only way to keep the roads clear.
Life was not longer something to endure, but to live.
Unless you have courage, a courage that keeps you going, always going, no matter what happens, there is no certainty of success. It is really an endurance race.
The men who learn endurance, are they who call the whole world, brother.
The bird that flutters least is longest on the wing.
He conquers who endures.
If God sends us on strong paths, we are provided strong shoes.
Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.
Don't fear the gods. Don't worry about death; What is good is easy to get, and what is terrible is easy to endure.
Endurance is not just the ability to bear a hard thing, but to turn it into glory.
Every calamity is to be overcome by endurance.
The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.
Endurance is nobler than strength, and patience than beauty.
For to be poised against fatality, to meet adverse conditions gracefully, is more than simple endurance; it is an act of aggression, a positive triumph.
Find out what you're afraid of and go live there.
Endurance is patience concentrated.
Not in achievement, but in endurance, of the human soul, does it show its divine grandeur and its alliance with the infinite.
A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on. Ideas have endurance without death.
The limits of tyrants are prescribed by the endurance of those whom they oppress.

If you can learn to endure pain, you can survive anything. Some people learn to embrace it- to love it. Some endure it through drowning it in sorrow, or by making themselves forget. Others turn it into anger.
No man ever threw away life while it was worth keeping.
If you are losing faith in human nature, go out and watch a marathon.
In the darkest hour the soul is replenished and given strength to continue and endure.
The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue; courage is only the second virtue.
